On Friday, June 19, the response window closed for the Western New York Regional Reopening Survey. The purpose of the survey, offered to stakeholders in seventeen Erie County school districts, was to inform the views of school superintendents as we participate in conversations about reopening school in September. The suvery feedback will be shared with the NYSED Reopening Task Force as well as with planning teams within our individual school districts.

We value the input and perspectives of our parents and staff members and the survey was one means for gathering that feedback while we await guidance from the Governor, State Education Department, and Department of Health. Final decisions about reopening will be made after the guidance is published.

Nearly 3300 stakeholders in Lancaster completed the survey. View the results below.

post_text: New this year at LHS is the Senior Prep program that helps our soon-to-be graduates get familiar with what comes next on their life's journey. This week, guest speaker was Transitions Program Social Worker, Mrs. Melisse Machnica, who spoke to the Senior Prep class about their college/career path and transition from high school. The session began with a job interview role-play in which Ms. Kelly Ambrose interviewed Mrs. Machnica for a part-time job at Target; mistakes were purposefully made for two reasons. First, it was entertaining and engaged the students immediately. Second, it fostered a discussion about the mistakes that were made and the corrections that would have made the interview successful. In addition, students reviewed career websites that Mrs. Machnica uses with students, and explored specific careers. Finally, students were given a self-assessment to complete on their own time, which asks them to rate themselves in a variety of areas that are important for post-school success.
